website_summaries.verdict: If you're after a stylish watch with some smart tech sprinkled on top, the Nokia Steel is for you. If you're keen on actual fitness tracking, jog on to other devices.
pros: The Nokia Steel is one of the best looking wearable devices you can buy and its battery lasts eight months
cons: Only offers basic fitness tracking compared to similarly priced competitors
No huge improvements over the previous model

customer_reviews.title: This watch is AMAZING. I love that it is stylish and I ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch is AMAZING. I love that it is stylish and I get compliments on it ALL the time. It has also made me realize that I wasn't getting as many steps as my old FitBit was claiming. Tested it out against several other trackers and the only one that said I had an abundance of steps was the FitBit - so this is obviously more accurate. And even though it looks more like a regular watch, it still tracks everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: JamesMarie

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointing. The sleep tracking is never right and I can't adjust it.
customer_reviews.text: So Disappointing. The sleep tracking is never right and I can't adjust it. I bought this to replace my Jawbone, which was awesome. This one never gets my sleep right, i.e., I go to bed at 9:30 and it says I went to bed at 10:30. If I get up for a little bit in the night at 3:30, it thinks I got up at 3:30, even though I went back to bed and slept until 6:00. I want to be able to adjust the sleep in the app. The only thing worse than no data is bad data.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch, but not the crystal.  Buy the Activite model instead.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea behind this watch: it's a stylish analog watch that tracks my steps and sleep and has a battery that lasts 9 months. Perfect! BUT, the watch crystal makes it almost impossible to see the subtle hour markings and in poor light even the hands. Plus, the silicone watch band started giving me a rash after a week. I bough the Withings Activite model with its sapphire crystal, leather band, and more prominent hour markings to replace the Steel. I am MUCH happier with the Activite.
customer_reviews.author: Utahangler

customer_reviews.title: Mostly happy
customer_reviews.text: I like this because: 1). I can see the time of day in all lights. 2) I don’t have to double tap, which doesn’t work half the time; 3) google is not privy to my health info - I trust European countries more than Google; and 4) it tracks the most important part of health - deep sleep, which recent studies indicate is most important. I know how many steps I take - I don’t know how well I sleep for a given seven hours. I agree with other reviews - the pedometer is not accurate,but who cares?
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after only 2 months!! At 1st I noticed the hour hand seemed a little out of position. I got used to it. Now the watch has stopped working after buying it at Christmas, and I have nowhere to turn because Amazon doesn't back this up after about a month!! Now it goes back to 7:20 on the watch and then runs erratically until it stops, and then I find it back at 7:20 again. Maybe the battery has died after only 2 months? Who knows. Think twice before buying this even though it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Powers 111

customer_reviews.title: Great Activity Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this product from Nokia. I wanted something that was sleeker than the typical exercise trackers and this device has been perfect. The watch looks great on my smaller wrist and the rubber band is lightweight and comfortable. The smaller dial is perfect for monitoring my activity throughout the day. I like that there are no flashing lights- I can easily look on my phone if I want specific details of my goals. The watch uses bluetooth just like other trackers. The watch was very easy to set up- as was connecting it to the app. My favorite part is that it runs on battery and I don't have to remember to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: JBDE

customer_reviews.title: Stylish.  Comfortable.  Alarm works...  mostly.  Not really an activity tracker.
customer_reviews.text: I got this mostly for the smart alarm feature. That feature mostly works. It's not as good as old jawbone bracelets, but still way better than standard alarm clock. Since I've gotten it, it woke me in the middle of the cycle only once because the actual alarm time has arrived. Everyone complements the style. Batter replacement is not too difficult and battery lasts a long time. As an activity tracker its not very good. It sort of counts steps and does reasonable. But other than walking doesn't really seem to track anything else. In the world of limited choices of smart alarms, I would probably buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: I loved this when I first received it
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I first received it. However, three weeks later I noticed the app needed an update; once I did that, the watch would no longer communicate with my phone (albeit an older model Iphone). Nokia's "help" site is useless; it simply redirects to information that gets more and more meaningless. I was sad to return the watch; I thought it was going to be just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Not the most advanced but it more than makes up for it in simplicity and elegance.
customer_reviews.text: This watch lacks some of the features of other fitness trackers. That is okay since it achieves what is required, tracking more or less the amount of activity of the person wearing the watch. Yes, there are more accurate models but it really doesn't matter all that much. We are humans, not robots after all. It has a beautiful finish, a quality feel, and a battery that doesn't require constant recharge. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Quincy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a good deal, bought it ,set it up and liked it . Two months later, not so much! It stated to lose a little time, then it would not sync. Went on line to troubleshoot, tried everthing it said at least twice, including changing battery. Nothing worked, i called the customer service, they were nice, but had me try everthing i had already done! Without getting it to work, decided to return it and get my money back. Have been trying to get refund instructions, at least six emails back and forth, I have not been able to.
customer_reviews.author: andrew beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: So much more convenient than a Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for about a year and a half, and I love it. First, you don't have to charge it. About once a year, take it to the jeweler and for about $10 have him/her replace the battery. I almost never take it off--I wear it in the shower. You can get an estimate of your steps looking at the face, but you can use the app on your phone to get a more accurate read and also a report on your sleep. I rarely bother using the app--for me, it's just a reminder to move. It doesn't matter if it's 5,000 steps or 5,024 steps, right? Bought one for my daughter, and she loves it,too.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Lingo

customer_reviews.title: Looks very nice.. Waterproof.. Counts some steps..
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks great. I wore a fit bit for 2 years and enjoyed them, but am tired of the look of smartwatches. This one never needs to be plugged in, doesnt look like a star trek prop, is waterproof, and so on... However, the watch is pretty bad about counting steps accurately... As in its only counting 7 out of 10 steps, .. Also, its a nice slim design that can work for men or women
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch but not good for alarm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for the silent alarm feature but found you can only set one. It vibrates 8 times and auto turns off, but then that's it! For morning's I like to set 2 alarms and wake up on the second one. With the watch, if you miss the first one, you'll sleep right through. I'm guessing they only allow one alarm to help with the battery life (which is great that you don't need to charge), but it doesn't work well if that's what you're looking for. Otherwise, nice looking and well made.
customer_reviews.author: No nonsense

customer_reviews.title: Misleading.. can't have more then 1 alarm set
customer_reviews.text: I'm really frustrated bc this device is so cool and the main reason I purchased it was for the silent alarm to remind me to take my meds (5 different times a day) ONLY to discover the app that this uses apparently only has the capability to have one alarm at once??? What a ridiculous design feature, I dont understand how this was made like that, especially when a main feature it advertises is the silent alarm feature - exceptionally misleading, it doesnt say a "wake up silent alarm" like the app does.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: It looks good, and is a relatively accurate step counter
customer_reviews.text: It looks good, and is a relatively accurate step counter. But I bought it because it was supposed to work as a fitness tracker, and particularly because it was supposed to work for tracking swimming. As far as I can tell, it absolutely does not work to track swimming. It also lacks a second hand, or a date function. So looks good, but functionally, not so much. Switched to an Apple watch, which does work in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Erik J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Simple
customer_reviews.text: This fitness watch is sleek and minimal. I like that there is a dial showing the number of steps right on the face of the watch- no tapping or clicking like with FitBit! It’s great to have the time automatically sync to my phone and I love that I don’t have to plug it in to charge it (it uses a watch battery which lasts for months). I purchased a refurbished watch and have been extremely pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Jane Lane

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! I haven't worn a watch in about 25 years, but my wife said, "I want to get you a watch for your birthday; pick one out for yourself." So I selected this watch that is more than a watch. It tracks my steps much more accurately than the step counter built in to my cell phone I had been using—and I don't have to pull my phone out of my pocket to either see what time it is or where I am on my daily steps! I got the black face Steel, and absolutely love its classy minimal design on top of it all. I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Matthew Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Black/Steel - main hands not so easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Pros: battery life, water resistance, and comfortable strap. Cons: The main time hands are not white but silver (the picture on closer examination does show them as being reflective) which makes them not as clear to read as the 0-100% hand which *is* white. The vibration is very weak - sort of expected in order to get the battery life - and I suspect not everyone might notice it while asleep (me for one!)
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The watch is very nice looking. The band it comes with is a little annoying to put on but it is still holding up so I haven't switched it out yet. I'm a little worried about how I'll change the battery when the time comes but so far it's a great watch. I really like that it counts steps and looks like a normal watch.
customer_reviews.author: Brusso

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch
customer_reviews.text: Wish Nokia put a glow in the dark needle , such a minor addition but a total disappointment since analog watch is one of its major selling point. As Fitness tracker , it is a mediocre performance compare to those flooded the market. Good enough for simply tracking your daily activities and exercise reminder. The upside are , the watch is quite beautiful and as fitness tracker it has the convenient of very long battery life. Added to it, it is waterproof !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks good & feels good
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this watch because I was curious to see what a fitness watch could do. Now that I’ve been using it, I’m very impressed by a couple of things. 1) It actually motivates me to get my walking done everyday. The gauge counter and the realtime progress tracking it does is highly motivating. 2) It is actually quite an elegant watch. It could easily pass for a high quality dress watch if you change the band (which I did). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Initially was working fine, but after one month it began losing the ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially was working fine, but after one month it began losing the time so I had to sync it to correct the hour. This was happening very frequently, and finally, stop working so I took the watch to change the battery, and that was it, never worked again, no way to synchronize.
customer_reviews.author: Igor krochin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, very happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grown son for Christmas & he loved it. He likes sleek & simple & is not a fan of today’s giant men’s watches. Nor does he do Apple products so an Apple Watch was out. This watch was a perfect match for him since it tracks activity but view it on phone so there is no “clutter” on the watch face. He was also very intrigued by the fact that there was no crown on th3 watch - all setting done with phone. It was a home run in terms of a gift For him & seems to be keeping accurate time & recording activity appropriately. Would absolutely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Deb North

customer_reviews.title: Fashion and Fitness
customer_reviews.text: Easy pairing and setup with the included guide and tool. Bought for my mother so that she could keep track of her activity and steps and so far it seems pretty accurate and the watch looks fantastic. The companion app is easy to use and view relevant information and seems to support a few 3rd party apps as well. Overall, for someone who cares about fitness tracking but doesn't want something that is as horrendous as a garmin or fitbit, this is the perfect device for you. It truly does look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: CWL

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a bit fragile
customer_reviews.text: Got this as gift for my daughter - the transient heat from an autoclave apparently cracked the crystal. This is the only sapphire crystal device that I have ever seen fail (yes, this exposure is typical for my entire family). Watch functioned well, sorry that it did not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stettler

customer_reviews.title: Worked for first battery, doesn't keep time with second battery
customer_reviews.text: The watch worked great for the first eight months. After battery change, I have to adjust the time hands every day. This is after I bought the manufacturer's recommended battery. Not worth $100 for only 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Halconegro

customer_reviews.title: Sleek Watch for Simple Needs
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the bulky look and frills of most smartwatches and want to escape my calls/texts, not put them on my wrist. For me, this is the perfect watch. It tracks my activity and motivates me to walk more, tracks my sleep so that I can sleep more consistently, and the vibrating alarm is strong enough to wake me up. If you are looking for a sturdy, waterproof, and simple tracking watch that looks sleek and professional, then this is the watch for you!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah DuFresne

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I like the traditional analog styling of the watch. It is well made and better suited for a professional environment than my Fitbit devices were. The downside is that the functionality is limited to steps and the alarm function. This is fine for me as steps are my goal, but if you want more, this may not be the product for you. Set up was super easy through the app.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely HATE wearing a FitBit with a coat and tie
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely HATE wearing a FitBit with a coat and tie. This was a perfect solution. Stylish and seems to be quite accurate. Admittedly, it does not have all the bells and whistles that are on a current FitBit, but if you simply want to track your activity and sleep, it does a great job. The App works just fine. Some of the younger crowd who feels that any watch under 44mm is too small may not find this guy (38mm) to their liking, but I am digging the old school size.
customer_reviews.author: monica w

customer_reviews.title: fogs up
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and both the watch and step tracker work well. The app is basic, but fine for me. However, what I don't like is that the glass fogs up on the inside and when it does it looks really bad. I bought the black one with no HR tracking. All I can think of is that it must have been assembled under very hot and humid circumstances (sweat shop? pun definitely intended.) Looks great in the hot tub, but that covers a tiny portion of my life. The company needs to address this issue. As it is I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Will Z.

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mainly for sleep purposes. The description states that it wakes you at an optimal time and that it measures your overnight heart rate. So disappointed as both of these features are very important to me, but this watch does neither.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Chen

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great, what's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It does all the tracking of activity and sleep I wanted, and it's stylish too. The thing I don't like about most activity trackers is they look ... well, kind of dumb. This just looks like a classy watch. I may have liked the steel HR with its heart rate tracking, but at double the price I just couldn't justify it. Suffice it to say, I'm very pleased with my purchase, no buyers remorse at all.
customer_reviews.author: W. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: OK, but don't love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and feel of this watch. It's very simple, elegant and can be worn at work - doesn't look like a fitness tracker. I only gave it 3 stars because it doesn't sync automatically with my phone (android) and watch steadily runs about 5 minutes slow. Seems very accurate for sleep and step tracking though.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Lots of sync issues after a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: The watch will not sync properly with the iphone app after a couple of months. I've had this issue with two separate Steel watches, and the customer support staff is completely useless. Unless you want to spend countless hours dealing with useless customer support or buy a new watch every six months, I recommend avoiding this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chin K Yoo

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: 3 weeks in and it looks and works great. Step/Activity tracker is nothing special, but compared to other activity watches it has way more style and doesn’t require charging. We’ll see how th longevity is. Every Fitbit I ever had(4 different devices) seemed to break around the 1 year mark
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not pair with the phone.
customer_reviews.text: There is no support for this product from Nokia. This is the third watch rom Nokia I have had with problems of not pairing with the app. This is the only way to control the features so.the watch is unusable. Nokia will not help since I bought from Amazon. This watch failed within 4 months. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Karausky

customer_reviews.title: Favorite tracker ever used
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch/tracker. It’s the perfect size for my tiny wrists (5’1” woman writing this review), and it tracks my sleep without me needing to remember to set it in sleep mode. And the silent alarm is the best alarm I’ve ever used—and I’ve tried a lot of different wake up methods. I absolutely love it. I DO wish the app let me set multiple alarms or goals. I feel like many of it’s features are only one or two options when ideally it’s something I need to be more flexible, like my NYC artist lifestyle. Great product though
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Mine had a defect
customer_reviews.text: The step count dial remained at zero when i took enough steps to move it. I sent it back. I hear Withings has bought the business back from Nokia. That might improve things.
customer_reviews.author: wfb

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy nice-looking and still keeping tracks
customer_reviews.text: I like the looks of the watch it is very elegant to wear to a formal night out and still keep tracks of your steps and other exercises. Easy to see how you have reached your goal and everything is recorded on your cell phone thru the App. Water proof to me is an extra bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice classic watch look + tracker
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact it has analog look, digital + BT integration with phone. I have other activity tracker and hands down this one offers way better functionally and esthetics. Long battery life is a big plus, as I do not like charging things frequently.
customer_reviews.author: bluelight

customer_reviews.title: .searching your watch....
customer_reviews.text: the watch does not really register the sleep phases accurately - there are lots of errors. Even whan the watch was on the bedtable, it registerd sleep. And the steps work well, but sometimes the conection can not be done ....searching your watch....
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Huber

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is elegant looking but works great as a fitness tracker. The health app is pretty good also. I did not want a heart monitor, text notifications, and I did not want it rechargeable. This takes a battery and it lasts up to 8 months. If you want a watch with fitness capabilities this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Martman

customer_reviews.title: Love it, love it, love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it, love it. Simple design, and yet functional. Easy to set up and use. One thing in particular that impressed me with this was the delivery time. I ordered it Tuesday and it arrived to me in South Korea on Friday 11am. I couldn't be more happy with the shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dunahee

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking watch and it pretty much does what it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking watch and it pretty much does what it's meant to do and that is track steps - I don't bother with the sleep. It's thin enough that it fits under one's shirt cuffs, doesn't look like a smart watch and, as a frequent flyer, automatically adjusts to new time zones (obviously because my phone has already). It has fantastic battery life - still showing a nearly full charge after months of use. I do wish it came in a 40mm size like the Steel HR and I cannot understand why it doesn't have a luminous dial - kind of hard to tell what time it is in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: A&B Danville

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably stylish smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: Despite of fact, that I was looking for sleep tracking watch, I bought this because it looks fantastic! Tha manual is very spartan, all setup should be done through the app. There is one small reset button on the back side, and when you press it successfully, the watch vibrates shortly. I opened once the watch, it has a simple back cover. Today I showered with it and have got fumes under the glass, so I understand, it not so waterproof anymore. So, 3 stars for being not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: evgeny

customer_reviews.title: Hard to tell the time
customer_reviews.text: Telling the time was extremely difficult, can’t see the markings because of the dark colors used.
customer_reviews.author: Hadas Lavy

customer_reviews.title: The clasp comes off the strap with relatively little effort.
customer_reviews.text: While the watch face functions as expected and works well, the clasp on the strap falls off every few days when I bump or rub by arm against something. I'm scared I'll lose the watch eventually. I purchased this to be delivered to me in New Zealand. There is no remedy for this issue for me as Nokia won't ship a replacement band to New Zealand. Beware! It might be better for you to buy this in your local country if you're outside of Europe or America as you'll get no physical product support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: did not keep time would have to resync to much
customer_reviews.author: Sankofa

customer_reviews.title: Elegant design but crystal is too soft
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a superbly elegant design, very informative and fun to use! BUT it does have a major flaw. The crystal is too soft and scratches very easily. After two months of gentle use it will have noticible scratches
customer_reviews.author: T. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Better looking than Fitbit; step and sleep tracker
customer_reviews.text: It's accurate. Easy to set up. Syncs with the app and is comfortable. Looks like a stylish watch but has the step counter on its face. Way better looking than a Fitbit and cost a little less. I had one day where it stopped syncing but I got lots of help from customer service. Got it running again.
customer_reviews.author: Klondike’s

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, comfortable. But had issues syncing and step hand fell off in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this watch at first, despite the issue I had trying to sync it with my phone every morning. (I found turning off wireless helped a lot. Wore it religiously for 3 months. Checking my stats, excited to see if my sleep score had improved, just looking down and easily seeing my progress in my steps for the day. But almost exactly three months, and the hand that counts steps has fallen off and is now floating around like confetti in the watch face. Such a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lula

customer_reviews.title: Great interface with my smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Sleek look. Great interface with my smartphone. If you want information at the touch of your finger, it's not for you... but if you want a dressy watch that is monitoring your activity, this watch is the way to go. At a good price too!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Easy and helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the way it took me no time at all to set up and I haven’t had any problems with it at all. I love that it looks like a regular watch cuz it is! But always shows and reminds me of my activity level.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Haddy

customer_reviews.title: Replaced older Garmen
customer_reviews.text: I love this fitness device. Looks like a simple watch, syncs with app easily and can stay on in the shower! It also interacts with other health apps. Haven’t used in pool, and don’t think I will.
customer_reviews.author: Carefulshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and works extremely well.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking watch with all the fitness/sleep tools you could want. Works very well on business travel as the watch isn't a "clunky" Fitbit type unit... It multi purposes well as a business/health monitoring device when on the road...
customer_reviews.author: Jay Gartlan

customer_reviews.title: great littl watch
customer_reviews.text: Keeps good time and when used with the Nokia 6 it keeps good records too!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great analog smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a couple of these now for myself or others. It's just a good product if you want an analog appearing watch that is waterproof and offers sleep and step tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Wristband is Kids size
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that kept me from giving it a 5, is the wristband. Its too small for my wrist and I am not an overly large man. When I contacted Nokia to exchange the band, they said it is the only band they have/use and gave no recommendations where to procure another band. I am not even sure of the size or the length so it would be difficult for me to order. Rather, I will have to go to jewelry store to get fitted. Other than that, it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rick F

customer_reviews.title: Ok Watch while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I liked the watch while it lasted (~6 months on battery). Like someone else here said it is a pain in the butt to get the battery replaced. Without the circular tool that comes with the watch you are S.O.L! Also, this doesn't capture swim activity which is a bummer. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dudeman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch. It’s stylish and it was helping me get in shape. But 8 months after I bought it (after the return and support services expired) the crystal cracked. Fixing it is estimated to be $160, which is more than the watch :(. I loved it, but I expect my things to last longer than 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Key R Rosebrook

customer_reviews.title: Not Nokia, pretty small
customer_reviews.text: I order the Nokia version and never get the correct item, received the withing, the regular one. And meanwhile, also, it pretty small.
customer_reviews.author: DFrrest

customer_reviews.title: Extemely Happy
customer_reviews.text: This phone is working out better than expected. Tracks sleep patterns and steps and is working seamlessly with my IPhone 7.
customer_reviews.author: P Sisco

customer_reviews.title: Its awsom
customer_reviews.text: i wanted a device to keep track of sleep and steps, but didnt want to wear a typical finess band like fit bit. This doesnt just that. It has an elegant design of a watch and does whatever fitness band can do. Best part is no need to keep charging battery. The battery runs for 9 months and can be replaced just like a regular watch.
customer_reviews.author: Divik Verma

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Elegant simplicity. Just what I needed to tell time and monitor steps.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with the watch and the provider
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and works exactly as she expected, very pleased with the watch and the provider.
customer_reviews.author: David Miller

customer_reviews.title: Avtivity counter does not reset
customer_reviews.text: The watch is sharp looking and I love the band. However, the step counter does not reset and the battery life is about 4 months. When looking to return the watch I cannot do so. Not happy with this product or the return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love my Steel
customer_reviews.text: I love my Steel. It does a great job step tracking. The best thing is that it doesn’t look like a fitness tracker it looks like a very classic watch. I also really like not having to remember to charge it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Evans

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give this one star
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and it seemed to work okay in the beginning. Had connection issues syncing to the phone and then it stopped counting anything (including the time). Went to Amazon support and they sent a replacement and the same exact thing happened all over again. Definitely wish I had not spent the time/effort/money on this, 10/10 would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and how it fits. Not sure it tracks everything but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Creations by Chris

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to have a decently stylish watch that tracked sleep and steps. Serves my purposes brilliantly. Looks great and has subtle classy display. The excellent no-charging battery life is an amazing bonus.
customer_reviews.author: KFL

customer_reviews.title: Smart and elegant!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, elegant design. Light and comfortable to wear. Excellent health and physical activity tracking futures. Bonus sleep tracking and scoring function. I am an active person by nature, but I have noticed that it encouragesme to be more active and so moor healthy!!! Best time piece I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jamshid Ebrahimzadeh

customer_reviews.title: fabulous watch & so much more
customer_reviews.text: tried many of these this is the best, simple but all the features u need
customer_reviews.author: Brian Card

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but didn't use and returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasing appearance, but I decided to return when I evaluated the cost and my probable use of it.
customer_reviews.author: little barbie

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. It will not keep correct time. Have to reset all the time. Paperwork said if it looses time, buy new battery and we had a new battery installed (not cheap). It still will not keep the correct time. Wife is very unhappy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: scs

customer_reviews.title: Husband LOVES this watch and in the 20 years we ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband LOVES this watch and in the 20 years we have been married he hasn't worn one. Sleek and gives lots of info.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M.

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully constructed watch
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully constructed watch. Easy to sync with your mobile devise and app. Wrist band is of quality silicone and not cheap looking. Would highly recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Starter smart watch for my teen...
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter’s first smart watch and she loves it. She is a swimmer and has enjoyed tracking her distance in and out of the pool. The sleep monitor is an additional benefit that she enjoys.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wall

customer_reviews.title: It has a nice style and does what it's supposed to do without ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a month now. It has a nice style and does what it's supposed to do without any hiccups so far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I am very dissatisfied with this product. Does record steps accurately. Doesn’t pick up sleep for days at a time. I’m disappointed that I cannot return this
customer_reviews.author: abeldia t.

customer_reviews.title: Loses time
customer_reviews.text: Loses time. I even changed the battery but it still loses about 12 minutes a day.
customer_reviews.author: Rjb

customer_reviews.title: ... a while to get the phone to recognize thewatch. Alarm feature was not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get the phone to recognize the watch. Alarm feature was not reliable. Feedback on steps and sleep was nice.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: No complains
customer_reviews.text: It's gorgeous and very comfortable. Didn't find any issue with connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: HRV

customer_reviews.title: Stylish. Smart.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Smartly detect many physical activities. It looks very stylish and can easily pairs with clothes. But the only thing is the glass can be scratched easily.
customer_reviews.author: OckhamZ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back - never would sync to the phone.
customer_reviews.author: booksandbelize

customer_reviews.title: Not scratch resistant!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product but easily scratched! Purchase the available protective cover!
customer_reviews.author: RajunCajun123

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and professional looking
customer_reviews.text: I switched from another tracker to the Nokia Steel because of the refined, professional look of the Steel. While the other tracker had more features, I wasn’t using them. I was only using the step tracking. And since I wanted something that looked sharper, I switched.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Ann Cox

customer_reviews.title: still works great after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I have had many compliments on this watch and it is not scratched, still works great after 6 months. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Ink Review

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and the data- I use the step count and sleep monitor. This is a great purchase. Everyone sees it on me and compliments it and wants their own.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Six months and the watch is still working great, highly recommend if you're looking to track your ...
customer_reviews.text: Six months and the watch is still working great, highly recommend if you're looking to track your steps and sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney McClary

customer_reviews.title: Just a pretty face but no substance
customer_reviews.text: I truly wanted this watch to work as advertised. It is sleek and looks nice. The watch keeps perfect time. That is the end of the good things I can say about this watch. The sleep tracker has not worked once. The step tracker only picks up about half of my steps. I have been through updates, factory resets, uninstall and reinstall. I have tried everything and it just will not work. After spending several days emailing with customer service to resolve the issues, it is still not working properly so I have to return it. I so hope they get this watch working. If they do, I will certainly purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: dcs nc

customer_reviews.title: Subtle, cool and Nokia
customer_reviews.text: Does what it promises, while looking very good. Silicone band can get a bit uncomfy in sweatier situations, but during summer the alternative Nokia (still available!) woven band is great replacement anyway.
customer_reviews.author: RaunoR

customer_reviews.title: A good price, too
customer_reviews.text: Provides some basic health information, but there’s not much of a match with Apple info from my phone. It syncs well with my phone. A good price, too.
customer_reviews.author: James Jarrard

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: the glass broken after 4 month, and the size is to big for kid's (8 years old)
customer_reviews.author: Margerit

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: The hand that tracks the steps malfunctioned after only two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kathyrn Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Like the sleep monitoring function!
customer_reviews.text: I like about its sleep monitoring function! It seems to accurately track my steps, sleep and exercise pattern:) Like it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Great device, so far i have yet to see a flaw. World be great as a gift too
customer_reviews.author: ZacharyE

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Really like our Nokia Steel watch my wife and I have one would recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: bill rogers

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in a month
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with the product for close to a month but it stopped working. The motion dial stopped working.. returning it now
customer_reviews.author: Sandhya Roy

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch/Tracker
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. Waterproof and has a watch battery. Love the way it tracks. Used to have a Garmin and replaced it with a Fitbit. After the Garmin I was really disappointed with the Fitbit. Came across the Nokia Steel and it does all I want and looks good also..
customer_reviews.author: Donna Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Elegant watch, great activity tracker for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: elegant watch, the smartphone app has an excellent user interface. Cons: No glass protection, so make sure you buy a screen protector for the watch
customer_reviews.author: Oliva Diaz

product_meta.title: Withings/Nokia Steel - Activity & Sleep Watch
feature_bullets: 24/7 seamless tracking - Automatic walk, run, swim & 10+ activities recognized. Plus calories burned & distance
Sleep monitoring - Sleep cycle analysis plus silent vibrating alarm with Smart Wake-Up to wake you at the optimal point
Premium materials - Stainless steel, chrome hands, silicone sport strap
Automatic synchronization - Visualize trends and data on your smartphone with the free Nokia Health Mate app
No charging - Up to 8-month battery life
Nokia Health is now Withings. Same products, same team, same commitment to your health. For more information, contact our support.
Withings products on must be “ships from and sold by” or Withings to be eligible for /replacement by Withings.
